summary: The federal government considers how tax policies affect taxpayers at various income levels—but knows little about how they affect taxpayers across other demographic characteristics (such as race, ethnicity, and sex). The IRS doesn't collect such information about taxpayers, but other agencies (like the Census Bureau) do. However, there are legal restrictions on sharing such data among agencies. We recommended that Congress consider revising relevant laws...
title: Tax Equity: Lack of Data Limits Ability to Analyze Effects of Tax Policies on Households by Demographic Characteristics
